title: Executive Order 8935-Exemption of William H. Tietgen From Compulsory Retirement for Age
content: Whereas, in my judgment, the public interest requires that William H. Tietgen, Marshal of the United States Customs Court, New York, New York, who, during the current month, will reach the retirement age prescribed for automatic separation from the service, applicable to him, be exempted from compulsory retirement for age for a period of six months:

Now, Therefore, by virtue of the authority vested in me by section 204 of the act of June 30, 1932, 47 Stat. 382, 404 (U.S.C., title 5, sec. 715a), I hereby exempt the said William H. Tietgen from compulsory retirement for age for a period of six months ending May 31, 1942.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 8935-Exemption of William H. Tietgen From Compulsory Retirement for Age Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/371687
